snippet: Aftab Bahadur was imprisoned on charges of killing a woman and her two children during a robbery attempt, but human rights groups say he was tortured into confessing.
abstract: Pakistani prison authorities execute Aftab Bahadur for murdering three people in 1992 when he was teenager, despite mercy pleas by rights activists and religious leaders and information found by death penalty opposition group that two witnesses recanted their statements and declared Bahadur innocent.
lead_paragraph: Aftab Bahadur was imprisoned on charges of killing a woman and her two children during a robbery attempt, but human rights groups say he was tortured into confessing.

headline.main: Pakistan, Brushing Aside Pleas for Mercy, Executes Man Convicted at 15
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Executes Inmate Despite Pleas From Rights Groups
